result.title: Simple Solution for 699-C Div2 & 698-A Div1 (Vacations)
result.content:
• we know that any day can be any option of four options
  • it shouldn't to be this day do option 1 and next day do option 1 or choose option 1 for option 3
  • it shouldn't to be this day do option 2 and next day do option 2 or choose option 2 for option 3
  • so that we can do dynamic programming to check all the possibilities
  • mainly we have 3 cases ,
  • first one previous day was option 1
  • second one previous day was option 2
  • third one previous day was option 0
  • in first case that is previous day was option 1 we can do in current day option 2
  • so if in array of days this day was 2 or 3 we will do option 2
  • but if in array of days this day was 0 or 1 we will take rest in this day
  • in second case that is previous day was option 2 we can do in current day option 1
  • so if in array of days this day was 1 or 3 we will do option 1
  • but if in array of days this day was 0 or 2 we will take rest in this day
  • in first case that is previous day was day off we can do in current day option 1 or option 2
  • so if in array of days this day was 1 we will do option 1
  • and if in array of days this day was 2 we will do option 2
  • and if in array of days this day was 3 we will take minimum cost that return by doing option 1 or option 2
  • after all we will take minimum cost of all these choices
